cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi SSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, forecast to cross the Cayman Islands and western Cuba, then track through the central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (near the mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas across Louisiana and Mississippi to Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are expected to reach the New Orleans area Sunday with a 61 % cumulative chance; hurricane-force winds are possible if the system strengthens as forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential dangerous storm surge exceeding 3 ft is likely along the southeast Louisiana coast, including areas near the Port of New Orleans, especially if Ida approaches as a strong hurricane.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands associated with Ida could bring 6â€“10 in or more, producing flash-flood potential in the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Life-threatening rip currents and very rough seas in approaches to the Lower Mississippi River channel.
